rounds.comments: (Alex: We'll give you the dance; you identify the country for us.)

clues.text: The square dance
The Cossack dance
The gavotte
The tarantella
The czardas
At the end of the Spanish Civil War in 1939, this man became dictator & remained in power until 1975
This city, Spain's second largest, has a museum devoted to Catalan art
It's Spain's only nationally owned airline
The vineyards of Jerez de la Frontera, north of Cadiz, provide the grapes from which this amber wine is made
It's 1 of 2 island groups considered Spanish provinces
clues.response: the Canary Islands (or the Balearic Islands)

clues.text: Robert Todd Lincoln ran this sleeping car company from 1897 to 1911
A 1950 Washington Post review of her singing said, "She is flat a good deal of the time"
On May 27, 1967 she christened the aircraft carrier named for her father
She was born Oct. 19, 1967, 15 years after her next youngest sibling
She is married to the junior senator from Virginia
In a health food store, vegetables grown without chemicals & pesticides are generally marked this
Some studies suggest that colon cancer is linked to a low intake of this plant & grain substance
These compounds, such as starches & sugars, are the main source of energy in the diet
A protein is said to be complete if it contains all of the "essential" ones of these
While a lack of this mineral can cause anemia, too much of it can damage the liver & other tissues
Erica Jong's "How to Save Your Own Life" was a sequel to this 1973 novel
The Reverend L.M. Birkhead of Kansas City was advisor to Sinclair Lewis on this 1927 novel
This Carson McCullers novel told the story of John Singer, a man who cannot hear or speak
His first novel was "Other Voices, Other Rooms"
This 1925 Anita Loos novel is subtitled "The Illuminating Diary of a Professional Lady"
Wm. Thompson, killed in action in 1950, was the 1st Black to win the Medal of Honor in this war
Speaking before the Democratic Nat'l Convention in 1988, he urged Americans to "keep hope alive"
He broke the color barrier in baseball, & in 1949 was voted the Nat'l League's most valuable player
When Victoria Woodhull ran for pres. in 1872, this orator was her running mate
In the 1837 Battle of Okeechobee, Black commander John Horse led these Indians
Its scientific name is Electrophorus electricus
Often 20 feet wide & weighing over 3,000 lbs. the giant devil is the largest of these rays
The mako species of this fish is considered one of the best for sport fishing
It's the Hawaiian name for the edible dorado or dolphinfish
The fastest fish over short distances, this marlin relative can breeze thru the water at over 65 mph
This comedienne was born in Brooklyn in 1933; we assume her first words were "Can we talk?"
Even though this angst-ridden director hails from Brooklyn, he called his 1979 film "Manhattan"
She was pecked to death by "The Birds" 9 years before she became Bob Newhart's TV wife
This muscleman wasn't an "Incredible Hulk" yet when he was born in Brooklyn in 1952
This Brooklyn-born beauty became famous playing Laura Petrie of New Rochelle
Pocahontas was in her early 20s when she died in 1617, probably of this pox
James Buchanan Brady wore such expensive jewelry that he was nicknamed this
In 1899 he published "The Development of Capitalism in Russia" under the pseudonym Vladimir Ilyin
Claude Francois de Malet was executed after he tried to overthrow this emperor in 1812
She attended an 1840 convention with her husband, H.B. Stanton, but, as a woman, was excluded from the floor
This 1859 tune completes the phrase "You ain't just whistling..."
It means to take a drink
The 1937 film that featured the tune "Whistle While You Work"
Dee Brown's 1977 book "Hear that Lonesome Whistle Blow" is about the building of these
This name for a small fipple flute makes cents
Because of its name, you'd expect to see lots of caressing in this type of zoo
This word can refer to a trap or a type of drum
This ceremonial staff borne by some dignitaries as a symbol of authority has a "spicy" name
Despite its name, this type of meeting doesn't have to convene on a mountaintop
This adjective meaning delectable may be an alteration of sumptuous
He was named after his great-uncle, the Reverend Warren Gamaliel Bancroft
Before his death in 1972, he remarked that he'd like his epitaph to be "he done his damndest"
Indians at the 1901 Pan-American Expo nicknamed him "Big White Feather"
Rutherford B. Hayes' middle initial stood for this
The music for his 1886 White House wedding was provided by John Philip Sousa & the Marine Band

rounds.text: Born to immigrant parents, in 1916 he was the 1st Supreme Court nominee to undergo public Senate confirmation hearings
